intro: Pahudia rhomboidea, commonly known as the Cape diamond, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, diamond-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with the flowers appearing in clusters at the tips of the stems.
